content:
Urban fantasy is a fantastic genre, and reading a completed series can be very satisfying. Here are some completed urban fantasy series that I highly recommend:

1. **The Iron Druid Chronicles** by Kevin Hearne: This series follows Atticus O'Sullivan, a 2,000-year-old druid living in modern-day Arizona. It's a fun, action-packed series with a great sense of humor. (9 books, 2011-2018)
2. **The Hollows Series** by Kim Harrison: This series is set in a world where supernatural creatures are part of everyday life. It follows Rachel Morgan, a witch and bounty hunter, as she navigates the complex world of vampires, werewolves, and witches. (13 books, 2004-2015)
3. **The Downside Ghosts Series** by Stacia Kane: This series is set in a world where ghosts, witches, and magic are real. It follows Chess Putnam, a witch and ghost hunter, as she battles addiction and the forces of darkness. (5 books, 2009-2012)
4. **The Jane Yellowrock Series** by Faith Hunter: This series follows Jane Yellowrock, a shapeshifting vampire hunter, as she battles vampires, werewolves, and other supernatural creatures in modern-day New Orleans. (13 books, 2010-2020)
5. **The October Daye Series** by Seanan McGuire: This series follows October "Toby" Daye, a half-fae private investigator, as she navigates the complex world of faerie politics and magic in modern-day San Francisco. (14 books, 2009-2020)
6. **The Charlie Madigan Series** by Kelly Gay: This series follows Charlie Madigan, a detective who can see into the mythological realm, as she battles supernatural creatures and tries to save her city from destruction. (5 books, 2009-2012)
7. **The Nightside Series** by Simon R. Green: This series follows John Taylor, a private investigator, as he navigates the dark and magical world of the Nightside, a hidden realm in modern-day London. (12 books, 2003-2013)

All of these series have received great reviews and have a dedicated fan base. I hope you find one that you enjoy!
